title: Klondike Gold Rush National Historical Park: Education
body: Gold Rush Fever in Victorian America Klondike Gold Rush National Historic Park preserves a special piece of America's story - the late 1800's gold rush to the far north. Use our resources to share this part of history with your students.Â                  Moore, Skagway and the Great Adventure Learn how thousands of brave souls stampeded north in the late 1800s, drawn to face danger and uncertainty in pursuit of gold. Read More        Field Trips Find resources to help plan your class field trip, either self-guided or led by a ranger. Read More        Fun for the Whole Family! Free programs for kids and families.  Learn about the great opportunities the park and the community offer visitors who are young or young at heart. Read More
